title: Authors and Citation
text: van der Ploeg G (2025). NPLStoolbox: N-Way Partial Least Squares Modelling Multi-Way Data. R package version 1.0.0, https://github.com/GRvanderPloeg/NPLStoolbox.
code: @Manual{,   title = {NPLStoolbox: N-Way Partial Least Squares Modelling of Multi-Way Data},   author = {Geert Roelof {van der Ploeg}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://github.com/GRvanderPloeg/NPLStoolbox}, }

title: N-Way Partial Least Squares Modelling of Multi-Way Data
text: NPLStoolbox allows researchers use N-way Partial Least Squares method multi-way data. ncrossreg() allows user identify appropriate number NPLS components data. triPLS1() allows user create NPLS model. npred() allows user predict y new data. package also comes example dataset Cornejo2025: clinical observational cohort study 39 transgender persons starting gender-affirming hormone therapy, containing longitudinally measured tongue microbiome, salivary microbiome, salivary cytokine, salivary biochemistry, circulatory hormone levels (doi TBD).

title: N-Way Partial Least Squares Modelling of Multi-Way Data
text: basic introduction package using example dataset given vignette("Cornejo2025_analysis"). vignette function documentation can found .

title: N-Way Partial Least Squares Modelling of Multi-Way Data
text: NPLStoolbox package can installed CRAN using:

title: N-Way Partial Least Squares Modelling of Multi-Way Data
text: can install development version NPLStoolbox GitHub :

title: N-Way Partial Least Squares Modelling of Multi-Way Data
code: library(parafac4microbiome) library(NPLStoolbox) set.seed(123)  # Process one of the data cubes from Cornejo2025 processedTongue = processDataCube(Cornejo2025$Tongue_microbiome, sparsityThreshold=0.5, considerGroups=TRUE, groupVariable="GenderID", centerMode=1, scaleMode=2)  # Prepare Y: binarized gender identity Y = as.numeric(as.factor(Cornejo2025$Tongue_microbiome$mode1$GenderID)) Ycnt = Y - mean(Y)  # Make a one-component NPLS model model = triPLS1(processedTongue$data, Ycnt, 1)

title: N-Way Partial Least Squares Modelling of Multi-Way Data
text: encounter unexpected error clear bug, please file issue minimal reproducible example Github. questions types feedback, feel free send email.

title: Cornejo2025 longitudinal dataset measured in transgender persons — Cornejo2025
Cornejo2025 longitudinal dataset measured in transgender persons — Cornejo2025
text: list object three elements: Tongue_microbiome List object tongue longitudinal microbiota data. Salivary_microbiome List object saliva longitudinal microbiota data. Salivary_cytokines List object longitudinal salivary cytokine data. Salivary_biochemistry List object longitudinal salivary biochemistry data. Circulatory_hormones List object longitudinal circulatory hormone data. Clinical_measurements List object longitudinal clinical outcome data. Subject_metadata Matrix subject metadata.

what: Cross-validation of NPLS by classical K-fold CV. — ncrossreg
title: Cross-validation of NPLS by classical K-fold CV. — ncrossreg
text: function runs ACMTF-R cross-validation. deterministic K–fold partition used: subjects split order cvFolds groups. fold training set consists folds test set current fold.

title: Cross-validation of NPLS by classical K-fold CV. — ncrossreg
code: ncrossreg(X, y, maxNumComponents = 5, maxIter = 120, cvFolds = dim(X)[1])

title: Cross-validation of NPLS by classical K-fold CV. — ncrossreg
text: X Centered tensor independent data y Centered dependent variable maxNumComponents Maximum number components investigate (default 5). maxIter Maximum number iterations (default 100). cvFolds Number folds use cross-validation. example, cvFolds 5, subjects deterministically partitioned 5 groups (CV iteration uses 4/5 training 1/5 testing). Default: equal number subjects (.e. jack-knifing).

title: Cross-validation of NPLS by classical K-fold CV. — ncrossreg
text: list two elements: - varExp: tibble variance–explained (X Y) per number components. - RMSE: tibble RMSE (computed unified CV prediction vector) per number components.

title: Cross-validation of NPLS by classical K-fold CV. — ncrossreg
code: set.seed(123) X <- array(rnorm(100 * 5 * 4), dim = c(100, 5, 4))  # Random tensor (100 samples, 5 vars, 4 vars) y <- rnorm(100)  # Random response variable ncrossreg(X, y, cvFolds=2, maxNumComponents=2) #> $varExp #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   numComponents     X     Y #>           <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1             1  4.32  9.72 #> 2             2  9.78 13.0  #>  #> $RMSE #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   numComponents  RMSE #>           <int> <dbl> #> 1             1  1.01 #> 2             2  1.04 #>

what: Predict Y for new data by projecting the data onto the latent space defined by an NPLS model. — npred
title: Predict Y for new data by projecting the data onto the latent space defined by an NPLS model. — npred
text: Predict Y new data projecting data onto latent space defined NPLS model.

title: Predict Y for new data by projecting the data onto the latent space defined by an NPLS model. — npred
Predict Y for new data by projecting the data onto the latent space defined by an NPLS model. — npred
text: model NPLS model newX New data organized matrix (Inew x J x K) Inew new subjects

title: Predict Y for new data by projecting the data onto the latent space defined by an NPLS model. — npred
text: Ypred: vector predicted value(s) Y new data

title: Predict Y for new data by projecting the data onto the latent space defined by an NPLS model. — npred
code: Y = as.numeric(as.factor(Cornejo2025$Tongue$mode1$GenderID)) Ycnt = Y - mean(Y) model = triPLS1(Cornejo2025$Tongue$data, Ycnt, numComponents=1) npred(model, Cornejo2025$Tongue$data[1,,]) #>             [,1] #> [1,] -0.00637789

what: Tri-PLS1: three-way PLS regressed onto a y vector — triPLS1
title: Tri-PLS1: three-way PLS regressed onto a y vector — triPLS1
text: Tri-PLS1: three-way PLS regressed onto y vector

title: Tri-PLS1: three-way PLS regressed onto a y vector — triPLS1
Tri-PLS1: three-way PLS regressed onto a y vector — triPLS1
text: X Centered tensor independent data y Centered dependent variable numComponents Number components fit tol Relative change loss model converge (default 1e-10). maxIter Maximum number iterations (default 100).

title: Tri-PLS1: three-way PLS regressed onto a y vector — triPLS1
text: Model

title: Tri-PLS1: three-way PLS regressed onto a y vector — triPLS1
code: set.seed(123) X <- array(rnorm(100 * 5 * 4), dim = c(100, 5, 4))  # Random tensor (100 samples, 5 vars, 4 vars) y <- rnorm(100)  # Random response variable model <- triPLS1(X, y, numComponents = 2)
